text: Here is the code I'm using for Hubdb filtration.

hello community, I have a question about HubDB filtering:
I have created a listing page with posts and each posts can have more than one category -> when I filter based on two categories for example `categ1, cate2` I want to show only the posts that have at least both/all the filtering categories. I have found on this doc <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/hubdb/v2/get_table_rows> there are 2 methods that I can use `__eq` the problem is that if the post has 3 categories and I search based on 2, even if they contain those, it will not show up.
The other filtering that I found is `__contains` or `__in` which again is not what I am looking for because that will search and see if one of the filtering is in that listing...

What I want is: if the post contains all the filtering categories regardless if they have more categories, to show up. Is it possible at all?
I have added that but still, behaves like this `column__contains=cate1,categ2`
which is not exactly what I am looking for <@U6GNQ7JBU>
It should AND both conditions together, so a row should only pass if it contains both `categ1` and `categ2`. If it isnâ€™t working like that then that means there is a bug
may I PM you my API url? <@U6GNQ7JBU>

Hi Everyone, I have created some dynamic pages into the HubDB. I want to add them to Sitemap. I can add to HubSpot sitemap only pages and blog posts but not dynamic pages. Is there a way to add them to HubSpot Sitemap? Or I have to create a static sitemap for dynamic pages? Thanks!
I think those dynamic pages should automatically be added. <@U6GNQ7JBU> might be able to confirm this.
